remarks: Peirce's theorem for a decidable proposition.  This odd-looking theorem can be seen as an alternative to ~ exmiddc , ~ condc , or ~ notnotdc in the sense of expressing the "difference" between an intuitionistic system of propositional calculus and a classical system.  In intuitionistic logic, it only holds for decidable propositions.  (Contributed by Jim Kingdon, 3-Jul-2018.)
statement: peircedc $p |- ( DECID ph -> ( ( ( ph -> ps ) -> ph ) -> ph ) ) $.
